results.title: Sister Forsythe's casebook
results.creator_credit: Barry Pierce, Tasmanian Film Corporation and Jack Zalkalns
results.brief_description: Outlines the work done by a school community nurse in early detection of potentially serious health problems in students. Shows diagnosis of petit mal, child abuse, depresion resulting from overweight, bed wetting, poor coordination. Notes how the school nurse works in conjunction with parents and techers.

results.title: Sisal
results.creator_credit: East African Railways and Harbours Film Unit and Gateway Film Productions
results.brief_description: An account of the cultivation and treatment of sisal, a raw material for rope making, in Tanganyika. Shows the way in which the leaves are removed from the sisal plant and conveyed to the decorticator machine; also the drying, grading, brushing and baling of the fibre. Illustrates the uses of the fibre; traces the history of the industry in East Africa and mentions problems associated with growth, processing and marketing.

results.title: Siroseeder
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
Siroseeder is a machine designed to spray a herbicide, cultivate the soil in narrow rows, insert seed and fertilizer at a predetermined depth, replace the soil and press it down lightly. Normally. farmers could use four implements and make up to eight passes to do the same job. If these and other experiments are fruitful, inputs of time, labour and fuel will fall dramatically, as will the risk of soil erosion.

results.title: Sirene
results.brief_description: Animated satire on present-day commercial life. Depicts a mermaid in the harbour of a modern city who is charmed by a young man playing a flute and attempts to flee with him, but the machines which surround the harbour destroy her. Interesting use of sound (contrast between the harshness of mechanical sounds, and the beauty of flute music), and the animation has a surreal quality that is quite effective.

results.title: Sir, you forgot to pay
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Kindergarten child series”.
Experience with numbers, dramatic play and concept formation are among the aims behind conducting a store in a classroom situation. Activities include experiment with barter, use of an adding machine and cash register, and the purchase of merchandise. Suitable for teacher/tertiary level.

results.title: Sir William Bragg: physicist experimentalist and teacher
results.brief_description: Sir William Bragg, in conjunction with his son, received the Nobel Prize for his work on X-rays and crystals in 1915. Here at the age of 74, he delivers a lecture about his life and work.

results.title: Sir Robert Scott
results.creator_credit: Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and British Information Services
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Commonwealth Teleview”.
Interviewed by Matthew Halton, Sir Robert Scott discusses his work as Britain’s Commissioner-General for South-East Asia. He talks about the importance of the area in Commonwealth and world affairs and some of the forces at work there such as SEATO (South East Asia Treaty Organisation) and the Colombo Plan.

results.title: Sir Oliver Joseph Lodge: mathematical physicist
results.brief_description: An historic film of Sir Oliver Lodge, mathematical physicist and winner of the 1932 Faraday Medal. Sir Oliver, in his 84th year, reviews the electrical age, recalling the early days of discovery including the first dynamo, and incandescent lamp, Alexander Graham Bell demonstrating the telephone, and the work of Hertz.

results.title: Sir Joseph Thomson
results.brief_description: Born in 1856, Joseph Thomson devoted his life to the study of physical science and acheived distinction as an experimentalist and as a teacher. In this film he presents a paper on the importance of scientific discoveries and their application in commerse and industry, resulting in employment and technological advances.

results.title: Sir Johnny-on-the-spot
results.brief_description: A marionette show set on the mythical Isle of Dragonia. Princess Moonglow has to choose a dragon to ride in the grand parade. Star is a beautiful but lazy and conceited dragon and his brother Spot is modest and punctual, but quite ordinary in appearance. She must select the first one she sees at sunrise. Encourages ideas about promptness, reliability and modesty. Suitable for middle primary level.
